channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This Hazmat was found by a package handler during the inbound sort, while unloading a trailer. It was improperly loaded on the trailer. The supervisors informed the admin, the admin found the hazmat damaged and got the Hazmat Drum, cleaned up the spill, and put in the hazmat cage in a drum.

item.title: Report X-2024050359
item.description:
Report X-2024050359

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs f release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single mental can with closure tabs on the lid. The top chime was dented causing the lid to open and the contents to spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024050358
item.description:
Report X-2024050358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was found with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans inside with Styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. A lid on one of the cans was oose causing a release inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024050238
item.description:
Report E-2024050238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3266-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged product, and spent absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024050108
item.description:
Report X-2024050108

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat spill. Leaking fiberboard box. Despite 96 applied by origin, package fails HAP due to 1) no overpack or UNPOP markings present; 2) Technical name used on shipping paperwork is trade name: (Limey Delimer). 0.4 gallon lost from four of four 1 gallon plastic bottles. Vented caps used but orientation arrows were not applied to two sides of package.
